definition: to sing the high part/to speak fine sounding but empty words (idiom)
to sing/to call loudly/to chant
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
erhua variant of 唱高調|唱高调[chang4 gao1 diao4]

sentences.english: This means you're talking high-sounding words or bushwa.
sentences.chinese: 唱高调就是说大话或者说空话。

sentences.english: The singer can sing high-pitched songs very well.
sentences.chinese: 这位歌手唱高调门的歌唱得非常好。

definition: empty words/bogus speech
to talk big/to sound off/bombastic/grandiloquent
(lit.) to fire blank shots/(fig.) to be all talk and no action/to shoot one's mouth off/to make empty promises
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
sensationalism/vulgar claptrap to please the crowds/playing to the gallery/demagogy
to show off (loanword, from English "show")/to grandstand/to perform in a stage show
empty talk/bunk/malicious gossip
to be all talk and no action
(idiom) to say one thing and do another
long-winded empty talk
to talk officiously/to assume the air of a functionary/to talk in official jargon
to resort to bragging and flattering
all talk and no action (idiom)/to preach what one does not practice/same as 光說不做|光说不做[guang1 shuo1 bu4 zuo4]
lit. to arrange a shelf of flowers/superficial display (idiom)
idle clamor/to prattle
superficial show/going through the motions
